SEARCH
Package src.client

Class ClientProtocol

java.lang.Object
src.client.ClientProtocol
public class ClientProtocol extends Object
Class used to handle incoming and outgoing messages, format them to fit the given protocol and perform certain actions.

    • ClientProtocol

  • Method Details

    • sendList

      public static String sendList()
      Sent by a client to request a list of clients who are currently logged into the server. Allowed at any point once the client is logged in, including during a game.
      Returns:
      the formatted message that can be sent to the server

    • sendQueue

      public static String sendQueue()
      Sent by the client to indicate that it wants to participate in a game. The server will place the client at the back of the queue of waiting players. When the command is issued a second time, the client is removed from the queue. The server does not send a reply.
      Returns:
      the formatted message that can be sent to the server

    • sendMove

      public static String sendMove(String move)
      Sent by the client to indicate which row(s) or column(s) the player wants to push. Only allowed when it is the player's turn.
      Parameters:
      move - - the move the user wishes to do (if it's valid hopefully)
      Returns:
      the formatted message that can be sent to the server

    • sendHello

      public static String sendHello(String description)
      The initial message sent by the client once a connection has been established.
      Parameters:
      description - - description of the things we have implemented
      Returns:
      the formatted message that can be sent to the server

    • sendLogin

      public static String sendLogin(String name)
      Sent by the client to claim a username on the server. When there is already a client logged in with this username, the server should respond with ALREADYLOGGEDIN, and the client should try a different username. Otherwise, the server will respond with LOGIN.
      Parameters:
      name - - username the user wants to claim
      Returns:
      the formatted message that can be sent to the server

    • handleIncoming

      public void handleIncoming(String incoming)
      Takes care of the incoming messages following their description in the protocol
      Parameters:
      incoming - - the incoming message

    • handleOutgoing

      public String handleOutgoing(String incoming)
      Takes care of the outgoing messages formating them and enacting any required action
      Parameters:
      incoming - - the outgoing message
      Returns:
      message formated according to protocol, ready to be sent

    • waitMessage

      public void waitMessage()
      Used for synchronization in waiting for an incoming message before performing an action

    • notifyOfMessage

      public void notifyOfMessage()
      notifies all the waiting threads that a new message came in

    • isLoggedIN

      public boolean isLoggedIN()
      Returns if the user is logged in or not
      Returns:
      is logged in or isn't
